keyTakeAways: Nicolas Sarkozy, former President of France, is serving a five-year jail term for criminal conspiracy involving illegal campaign financing from Muammar Gaddafi.
Sarkozy is the first former head of an EU state to be imprisoned, marking a historic precedent in European political accountability.
The charges stemmed from accepting millions of euros from Gaddafi to fund Sarkozy's 2007 election campaign, which he has consistently denied.
Sarkozy arrived at La Sante prison in Paris in a police vehicle, with supporters and family members protesting outside his home.
He is to be held in solitary confinement in a nine-square-metre cell, with one daily walk and three weekly visits.
Judge Nathalie Gavarino described the offences as of 'exceptional gravity' and ruled that incarceration is mandatory even if an appeal is filed.
His lawyers have filed an appeal, and the court has two months to review the request for release.
Sarkozy reportedly intends to bring a biography of Jesus and a copy of 'The Count of Monte Cristo' with him, a symbol of his belief in innocence and eventual justice.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has begun serving a five-year jail sentence for criminal conspiracy related to illegal campaign financing from Libya's former leader, Muammar Gaddafi, in 2007. As the first former head of an EU state to be imprisoned, his case represents a historic moment in political accountability. Despite his denial of guilt and claims of innocence, the presiding judge, Nathalie Gavarino, described the offences as of 'exceptional gravity' and ordered imprisonment even with an appeal. Sarkozy is being held in solitary confinement at La Sante prison in Paris, with limited contact and visits. His lawyers have filed a release appeal, which the court will review within two months. The incident has sparked public outcry, with supporters gathering outside his home to protest, and has drawn comparisons to the imprisonment of Nazi collaborator Philippe Petain, underscoring its significance in French political history.
title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy starts five-year jail term
